sentences.english: One New Jersey man decided to paint the exterior of his house to save money.
sentences.chinese: 新澤西有位仁兄爲了省錢，決定自己粉刷屋子的外牆。

sentences.english: One man deftly plays the two- stringed instrument.
sentences.chinese: 有個仁兄熟練地拉着這種二絃樂器。

sentences.english: A fellow bought a new Mercedes and was out on the interstate for a nice evening drive.
sentences.chinese: 有位仁兄買了新的賓士，晚上開到州際公路享受。

definition: brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
lit. older brother/fig. fellow students who are successful in the imperial examinations
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
son of an official/son of nobility/your son (honorific)
benefactor (term used by a monk to address a layperson)/donor (semiconductor)
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
